byline.contributor: Serge Kovaleski contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Grammy-winning singer and songwriter Judith Hill recalls fateful flight with pop icon Prince, during which she witnessed him fall unconscious six days before he died of accidental overdose of opioid painkiller fentanyl; Prince was extremely private star who hid his addiction to prescription drugs, even from his inner circle, which included Hill.

headline.print_headline: Frantic Moments on Prince’s Plane as He Seemed to Slip Away
headline.main: I Was on That Fateful Flight With Prince: A Protégée Tells Her Story

snippet: Judith Hill was sitting on a plane with a man she loved, when suddenly he lost consciousness. She shouted his name: Prince. But he didn’t come to.
lead_paragraph: Judith Hill was sitting on a plane with a man she loved, when suddenly he lost consciousness. She shouted his name: Prince. But he didn’t come to.
